title: Set uploaded image as landing page hero image (static asset)

requirements.summary: Ensure the landing-page hero image file exists in public static assets so AuthGate can load it at the existing URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Requesting `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` in the deployed app returns HTTP 200 and renders an image (not a 404).
The landing page hero image displays without triggering the error fallback in normal conditions.

file_operations.description: Add the hero image as a public static asset so it is included in the frontend build output at the exact path used by AuthGate (`/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg`).

requirements.summary: Replace the hero image content with the newly uploaded image while keeping the hero image URL unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The file `frontend/public/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` is produced from `image-8.png` and is a 1600×600 JPG.
No code changes are required to the `src` URL in `AuthGate.tsx` (it remains `/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg`).

file_operations.description: Regenerate/replace the file contents using the uploaded `image-8.png` as the source: crop/resize to a wide hero and export as a 1600×600 JPG, keeping the filename exactly `frontend/public/assets/generated/home-hero.dim_1600x600.jpg` so the public URL path remains unchanged.

requirements.summary: Preserve the existing hero image load-error fallback behavior and stable layout in AuthGate.
acceptanceCriteria: If the hero image fails to load (e.g., missing asset), the placeholder block renders and maintains the same aspect ratio as the image container.

file_operations.description: Confirm the hero image error handler and placeholder rendering remain intact; ensure the placeholder and image container continue to enforce the same aspect ratio so the layout stays stable when the image fails to load, without changing the hero image `src` path.
